Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: THCA

Reviews.Content: Outstanding I stayed at Alam Jiwa with my wife and son (3yrs old) and with friends and their two kids (2 and 11months) for 10 days. This was my first time here but my 10th ish time in Bali. The place was perfect for us. We rented one unit and our friends rented the upstairs unit. In the evenings we would congregate on the balcony for drink and look out over the small gorge to the rice fields beyond. The breakfasts in the morning were great (again on the balcony or in a small seating area near the pool) and consited of fresh fruit, omelletes, jaffles, coffee, or balinese porrige.Going into town is very easy - a short stroll through the village (much nicer than Ubud proper, through (or around) Monkey Forest and there you are in the thick of it. 10mins. Sometimes we would use the free shuttle that the hotel prvided if we were going out to dinner.Although we travelled with small kids I think it would also be a perfect place for couples since all the accomodation is situated in seperate houses (see photos and google earth). Finally the staff were fantastic, naturally warm as most Balinese are. The place is beautiful, the staff are great and it has soul which some of the other - beautifully and slickly crafted - resorts lack.
Reviews.Author: sunshiny_8

Reviews.Content: What a find!! This was a wonderful place to stay if you want to get out of the hustle and bustle of Ubud. Since we love to walk, the walk into Ubud was easy but hot! (Watch out for the monkeys trying to steal your shopping bags and water bottles.) We enjoyed the lovely surroundings, the quietness and how friendly and helpful the staff was. We had quite a few meals at Leke Lake down the road and even took a cooking class there. Also took advantage of the spa (can't remember the name) and had some hours of pampering.We were worried about no air conditioner but with the ceiling fan and cooler temp in the evening it turned out just fine.
Reviews.Author: Lv2trvl82

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Place       breakfast
Reviews.Author: I_rock_it

Reviews.Content: This is the best We loved this place and wrote a review the minute we came home 2 weeks ago and so here we are again. Room perfect !Balcony perfect !Pool Perfect ! Employees perfect. ! We have traveled the world you would be an idiot to pass this up. Mimi Denver
Reviews.Author: MIMIDenverColorado

Reviews.Content: Relaxing haven of tranquility       View from the Veranda
Reviews.Author: gwyn4940

Reviews.Content: An amazing place... we dream of returning one day This has got to be one of the most friendly, unspoilt, beautiful places to stay in the world. We were treated like royalty by the staff. Beautiful home cooked food. nothing too much trouble.
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetlady

Reviews.Content: The nicest hotel I ever stayed in This may not be a 5 star hotel but the ambiance, the rice field views, the service, the wonderful staff, the beautiful gardens and pool, and little things like fresh flowers and fruit in your room, make it the best spot for a peace and beauty lover that you can find anywhere. At the price it would be very hard to beat. We loved it, and our only regret was that we could not stay longer as it was totally booked out after our booking.
Reviews.Author: ivorbk

Reviews.Content: IN LOVE with Alam Jiwa       balcony overlooking paddy fields
Reviews.Author: jaya77

Reviews.Content: Not many place you can find like Alam Jiwa or Alam group. Once again we had a wonderful time at Alam Group (this time we stayed at Alam Jiwa) in Ubud.Alam Jiwa was little bit cozy than Alam Shanti which we stayed last year. However the service and the staff are pretty same and we had a wonderful time.Only thing I would like to say was...we booked mountain bike tour through the reception. We had a problem when it comes for payment. We wanted to pay by credit card and tour company and reception didn't inform us that we could not pay by credit card. ( which was almost 1 million Rp) At the end we found out we could pay by credit card through tour company but because the tour company didn't want to pay 3 % sur charge to credit card company, they refused to accept credit card. Of course when we asked Alam Jiwa to put on our hotel bill they informed us about 3%,,,Anyway Sometimes Balinies does not communicate us for good heart. I know it was not Alam Jiwa's fault but at least we wanted to know before we went to tour, about payment from tour company or Alam Jiwa.Other than that. the room was great (our room Caswary did not have stand shower just shawer at bath tub) but enough space, and afternoon tea and coffee with Cafe Wayan cake was great.
Reviews.Author: makichan

Reviews.Content: Alam Jiwa: a great place to be       Upstairs bedroom in Cendrawasih suite
Reviews.Author: atrejseeratleve

Reviews.Content: The best boutique hotel in the world We have lived in Singapore for 7 years and have been going to Bali for r+r about twice a year. Luckily we discovered Alam Jiwa on one of our first visits and have been going there numerous times since. It is like our home away from home.Highlights: Excellent and friendly staff; large comfortable room; big balcony overlooking the rice fields; very good prices; great place to hang out and do absolutely nothing. By the same owner you will find Alam Shanti next door and Alam Inda further down the road, both very nice but with a different feel. We have a crush for Alam Jiwa, although it is getting a bit dated. The owner mentioned he would start renovations this year. Alam Shanti is brand new so if you prefer new choose this one. I don't think it has as good a view over the rice fields but it still very nice.
Reviews.Author: asia4me

Reviews.Content: Checked out in the very last minute to fully enjoy this magical place...       Morning rice field views
Reviews.Author: jeroens

Reviews.Content: Peace baby I recently stayed here with my mother, sister and 2 young children and we all really loved it. We stayed for 3 nights which i think was ample. The spacious 3 levelled guest house we had was really beautiful. If you have ever been to Jim Thomspson's house in Bangkok, it reminded us of this. Excellent interior which overlooks rice paddies and a very peaceful rural scene. Watch the 'duck man' from the comfort of your kingsize bed with his flock of ducks in the morning. Staff very friendly and unobstrusive, breakfast can be delivered to your room or you can have it in the cafe. For a slice of the real Bali i would stay here or at the sister hotels, Alam Shanti and Alam Indah.
Reviews.Author: Griswalds4

Reviews.Content: Absolutely lovely!       9
Reviews.Author: viefje

Reviews.Content: Great choice if you don't mind being a little isolated I'll try to be fair here - this is a very pleasant hotel and obviously most people are quite happy with it - it just wasn't the right choice for me. Hope this might help someone else looking for the same type of experience.I knew Alam Jiwa was outside of Ubud, but was under the impression it was just a 10 minute walk away. It was more like a 15 minute walk either through or around the Monkey Forest (loved it!) to the start of Ubud's main shopping/dining area. Then, another 20-30 minutes walk to the center of Ubud. I am an active person and love walking, but that was way too much to be doing every day, even for me, in heat and humidity.There is a free shuttle provided by the hotel, but this can be slightly inconvenient if, like me, you want to just go independently when and where you want.Basically, for me Alam Jiwa was a bit too isolated. The location was pretty, but not spectacular. It is in a village south of Ubud, with a few shops (for locals and tourists), a school, and football field - a moderately interesting place to walk around, but nothing like the variety of central Ubud.I had a lower-level room with air-con. The room was traditionally decorated, with a very large covered private balcony. A nice room, but not great. Room lighting at night was very, very dim - if you like to read at night, bring a flashlight!Service was very good and I especially liked having breakfast delivered to my room every morning. There's a small pool that I didn't use. Rate was $85 per night. Overall it was a charming place with helpful and pleasant staff, and certainly worth the price. It just wasn't right for me.
Reviews.Author: JFH1107

Reviews.Content: Romantic escape at Alam Jiwa       Entrance to our villa
Reviews.Author: Troodee

Reviews.Content: Good immersion in local Balinese living My wife and I stayed at Alam Jiwa for 3 days, 2 nights, during our honeymoon in Bali.Although Alam Jiwa is located off of a narrow road that juts off a road between Sayan and Hanoman road, I highly recommend that your driver be able to speak Balinese to find this place if they haven't been here before. It's definitely tucked out of the way from the main roads, which lends it a very nice feeling of what it must be like to live like a local. Front staff and groundskeeping crew were very polite and friendly. Our greeter was an older gentleman with glasses who spoke so softly yet directly that it caught me off guard. Our greeter/front office manager provided us an overview of services, made us aware of the free breakfast and complimentary afternoon tea services provided by Alam Jiwa, as well as a free shuttle from Alam Jiwa into town and back. All we had to do was call the number on their business card to request driver pickup. Front staff provided luggage porters to assist us with our luggage. We stayed at the Garuda room which had large windows that provided an unobstructed view of the rice fields on the backside of the property. It was calming to see the rice field workers make their way into the fields to perform to their duties each morning. Although Alam Jiwa had a small pool, my wife and I did not take advantage of it during our stay. The pool was not as relaxing as Uma Ubud, and not as grand as the Ritz Carlton Bali. I would say that the pool was so small that it got crowded fairly quickly. First impressions were, whoa, this is one big room for the price that we paid. Much bigger room than all of our others during our honeymoon (Ritz Carlton, Uma Ubud, Bayu Cottages, Ellie's). Alam Jiwa didn't feel so much like a hotel as it did a private residence with unusually large rooms and individual patio areas. Complimentary bottled water awaited us in our rooms as did complimentary fresh fruit. Upon arrival we had a knock on our door with a gentleman providing us complimentary welcome fruit drinks. Very nice way to arrive. The large bed (King size) had a circular mosquito netting with a heavy weight at the bottom that kept insects out. The entranceway to the bathroom had the most interesting frog motif over it, while utilizing traditional Balinese double doors for privacy. The bathroom was very large complete with a drying rack for clothes and a deep tub that gave you a clear view of the rice paddies behind the building. The location of the air conditioning unit in the bedroom makes it not too effective in cooling off the bathroom. But it wasn't an issue for us given Ubud's cooler climate at the time that we visited. None of the rooms in Alam Jiwa have a telephone, or television for that matter. Don't even bother looking for a clock. Oddly enough, at every one of our hotels, NONE of them had a clock. Apparently time means very little in Bali since it's so beautiful that you naturally want to take your time. But that being said, if you were truly looking to disconnect from the wired world, this was a good place to slow time down and relax. Morning breakfast was good. Coffee and tea were good, and I would recommend sticking with the Indonesian fare for breakfast instead of the pancake option. Their pancakes aren't Western style pancakes, more like a crepe, although I liked their mueslix with yogurt and fresh fruits. Definitely recommend their fruit juice mixes. Their staff does a pretty good job on them. The one thing that I would note is that the proximity of the rice fields allows you to get closer to the wildlife. Although my wife and I had breakfast out on the patio, you had to be careful with all of the ants along the floor not to provide them a leg for them to crawl up, or to drop food that would cause them to swarm. It should be noted that we did not notice any ants in our room. Also, our first night at Alam Jiwa, we experienced first hand why the Balinese consider geckos lucky. A huge gecko popped out from behind a large Balinese painting, FLEW down the wall and snapped up a very large beetle before zipping back up the wall behind the painting in under 2 seconds. I jumped because I thought it was a very quick snake. If you absolutely can't stand seeing a little local Balinese wildlife share the room with you, Alam Jiwa may not be the best choice for you. The location of Alam Jiwa made it a fairly short 10 minute walk through the Monkey Forest of Ubud to the shops of Monkey Forest Road and JL Bisma. Alam Jiwa is about a good 30-45 minute walk to the Ubud Main Road however, and I would not recommend walking through the Monkey Forest Road at night for personal safety reasons. While we were there we were unable to contact Alam Jiwa for a ride back to the hotel because of some kind of busy tone on the telephone network. It should be noted that Bali apparently uses the same kind of telephone switching system that was used in the U.S. during the 1950s. As a result, wireless phones are significantly more reliable than landlines in the country. The ride back to the hotel from Ubud Main Road was about $3USD. On a separate note, wherever shopping/massage place we went in Ubud, everyone asked us where we were staying. When we answered Alam Jiwa, I swear we seemed to get better pricing than when we answered Uma Ubud (a pricier hotel). Something to keep in mind when bartering for some great gifts and souvenirs to take home. My wife and I asked the front staff on entertainment recommendations in Ubud. They made an outstanding recommendation to see a local traditional Legong dance. Great show, definitely a must see if it's your first exposure to traditional Balinese dance. Also requested info on great places to dine. Alam Jiwa made an outstanding and ok recommendation with the Dirty Duck and Cafe Wayan respectively. All in all, a very economical way to spend a few days in Ubud, if you can tolerate the curiosities of minor wildlife.
Reviews.Author: maxim531

Reviews.Content: Treated like royalty, loved it! We stayed in Bali for 3 weeks and decided to spend some nights in Ubud after our initial stay in Sanur. We booked a superior room (USD 65.-) at Alam Jiwa with a beautiful view on the rice fields. Room and hotel staff were both lovely and we were treated like royalty. The hotel consists of total 10 large rooms spread over 5 cute houses. Breakfast is served on your private terrace if wished. Alam Jiwa is located outside of Ubud just next to the sacred monkey forest. Any time until 10pm, a driver will bring you to Ubud and pick you up when you wish to return. This is as close as you can get to nature  rice fields (waking up by the sound of geckos included).We will definitely return to Alam Jiwa!
Reviews.Author: Mirre80

Reviews.Content: Simply perfect (Pierre from Sweden)       Breakfast with a view
Reviews.Author: Pierrefromsweden

Reviews.Content: the best vacation, ever... don麓t miss this in Bali... my husband and I spent 4 days at Alam jiwa and this was the best vacation we ever had.We have traveled a lot and lived in Europe, Tokyo and now Singapore for the past 6 years, but this place felt special.The hotel has nice, clean and spacious room with lots of windows, AC and a big bathroom. Breakfast served on the balcony with fantastic view over mountains and ricefilds. After noon t茅 by the pool area and service to take you by car to Ubud, approx 5-7 min, and home again for free, was unexpected and appreciated by us. We felt like we were alone in this place, although they have 5 houses with 10 rooms. The staff were gentle, serviceminded and very helpful.We walked every day thrue the monkey forrest to Ubud for lunch and strolling around all the galleries. The nearby restarant Laka Leke, 5 min walk from the hotel had bali dance of children and good balinese buff茅 that was fantastic.And Cafe Wayan in Ubud, same owner as the hotel, with secluded areas to sit in the big garden, had sunday dinner buff茅 and bakery.Don麓t miss the Bali-dance at the temple in Ubud and rice-paddy walk though Ubud Kaja, approx.2.5 h, if you have the time..So thank you for a wonderful memory from the swedish family in Garuda .. now we heading for Puri Bagus Lovina for SPA and finally Nirwana golf and spa resort for golfing.. thank麓s again..
Reviews.Author: AnnSingapore

Reviews.Content: We *LOVED* this place! My husband and I stayed at Alam Jiwa for 5 nights in December, and we couldn't have been more impressed. I stayed at its sister hotel, Alam Shanti, with a friend in May and absolutely loved it, so I was disappointed that AS was already booked and that I had to go with AJ instead. I still can't believe that Alam Jiwa was even nicer!We booked through their website for US$65/night and had a enormous room overlooking rice fields. The king-sized bed was very comfortable, and I felt like a princess surrounded by its mosquito netting. The bathroom was also huge and provided everything you could possibly want, including a hair dryer, which is NOT always the case in many Asian hotels. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast each morning on our lovely veranda and a relaxing swim every evening in their perfect-temperature pool. The grounds of Alam Jiwa are absolutely beautiful and provide a surprising amount of privacy.Alam Jiwa freely and happily provides whatever transportation you require in the Ubud area. I felt like we REALLY took advantage of this by frequently going into town separately, and they didn't bat an eye. We also arranged transportation to and from the airport through Alam Jiwa and a tour of the area down to Tanah Lot, and all was comparably priced, if not cheaper, than what we could get in town.The staff was incredibly helpful, always smiling and friendly. They mailed our postcards, made massage reservations, pre-ordered smoked duck, brought us tea in the afternoon... We absolutely loved this place and would go back in a second. The most relaxing vacation we've ever had.
Reviews.Author: manterv

Reviews.Content: Value for money, above expectation       balcony
Reviews.Author: Estherhunting

Reviews.Content: Really great, but needs a bit of maintenance       The balcony from Merpati room
Reviews.Author: qwertyHound

Reviews.Content: Fabulous One of the finest small hotels we've ever stayed in, with huge rooms overlooking the rice terraces, an inviting swimming pool, outstanding breakfast (either served in the comfortable little central dining area or delivered to the room), free transport all over Ubud and an extraordinarily friendly staff -- all for $65 a night!
Reviews.Author: RVS798

Reviews.Content: Alam Jiwa is lovely and so friendly!!       Our bed
Reviews.Author: astro50

Reviews.Content: simply magical       fantastic pool, relaxing pavilion
Reviews.Author: watsoneast

Reviews.Content: Magical Alam Jiwa 5 Star Service on a Budget Let me start by saying that we have stayed in many 5 star hotels and resorts across America and in the Hawaiian Islands. I have also been to Bali ten times and have stayed in every type of lodging available there. The Alam Jiwa in Nyuh Kuning just outside of Ubud has raised the hospitality bar to a new level and has become the gold standard for every new resort that we will vacation at from this point on. Alam Jiwa is a small ten room hotel set within beautiful gardens with stone walls and pathways that make the place truely magical. The rooms, housed in four three story bungalows and each different from the next, look out to the rice fields with a view of Mount Agung in the distance. Our favorite, The Merpati Room on the third floor, had a large open air bathroom, a canopied king bed with plenty of room for a single cot for our daughter, and a large terrace furnished in Indonesian Antiques. For $85 a night my husband and five year old daughter and I were treated like royalty. A full breakfast of our choosing- fresh juice, coffee, fruit salad, freshly baked breads, and omelets or crepes were served every morning at either our terrace or at the little dining area overlooking the pool and gardens. Every afternoon fresh cakes and tea were served poolside or at our terrace. The owners also have a restaurant several blocks away and you can order meals to be delivered and served on your terrace at any time of day. Also included in the price of our stay was a 8am-10pm shuttle service at our disposal to take us into Ubud, pick us up from our spa appointments and deliver us to Dance performances in the evenings. This was such a great service and we used it at least twice a day. If we chose to, we could take a 20 minute walk into Ubud via the monkey forest that separates Nyuh Kuning from Ubud. The Monkey forest has thankfully prevented the commercial sprawl of Ubud from spilling into this little village and a sense of peaceful retreat prevailed at Alam Jiwa, our home away from home for three weeks in June 2004. There is nothing pretentious about this place. The staff's friendliness and warmth is heartfelt and no trouble is too much for them . We took a side trip for four days and when I asked Ayu, the assistant manager about settling our bill, she said we could take care of it when we returned. Such trust and graciousness. They really did become like family to us as we got a chance to talk with these dear people. Comang, the wonderful manager who has done a stellar job of training his crew, took Us out to dinner on our last night. Our daughter cried when we had to leave and told Comang that next time we will stay for a year. We were ready to move in.If you are the sort of traveller who needs to spend a lot of money or treat the staff like mere servants in order to feel that you are getting the 5 star treatment that you need, then stay at anyone of the foreign owned chain resorts that has sadly come to clutter the pristine Bali landscape over the past dozen years. If you would like a chance to feel that you are supporting the local economy and getting to experience authentic Balinese hospitality, book a room at the Alam Jiwa.Check out their website. It really doesn't do the place justice. The hotel was even featured in Conde Nast's Traveller Room with a View page last year. For the money, nothing can touch Alam Jiwa.
Reviews.Author: lalalalalalalala
